arts.ttl: Iconic Isidor scores last-gasp winner as Sunderland sensationally beat Brentford
arts.sum: Sunderland secure a stunning last-gasp 2-1 victory over Brentford at the Stadium of Light on Saturday afternoon thanks to Wilson Isidor's late winner.

arts.ttl: Wilson Isidor off bench to seal dramatic Sunderland comeback over Brentford
arts.athr: Louise Taylor at the Stadium of Light
arts.sum: It is no secret that Régis Le Bris hopes to sign another striker before the transfer window music stops on Monday night but maybe, just maybe, Wilson Isidor gave Sunderland’s manager pause for thought in stoppage time. Isidor stepped off the bench to score his second goal in three Premier League appearances as Le Bris’s team made it two wins from three. With this degree of defensive organisation allied to Enzo Le Fée’s creative flair they could yet prove more than capable of making a successful adaptation to their new top tier habitat. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Andy’s Player Ratings: Sunderland 2-1 Brentford – Isidor tops off the perfect week with a late winner!
arts.sum: Robin Roefs: 8/10 Brilliantly saved a penalty and although he didn’t really have another save to make – he only just missed the header for the opening goal – he just oozes confidence. So assured with the ball at his feet. Trai Hume: 8/10 Couldn’t cover in time to prevent the opening goal but defended […]

arts.ttl: Le Bris urges Sunderland to "stay adaptive" ahead of Brentford test
arts.sum: There will be inevitable inconsistencies in Sunderland's results due to their competition and adjustment to Premier League football, despite much of the squad experiencing the heights of the European game. Sunderland suffered defeat to League One outfit Huddersfield Town in the second round of the Carabao Cup in midweek in front of their home supporters.

arts.ttl: Brentford XI vs Sunderland – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Brentford travel to the Stadium of Light on Saturday in a confident mood, aiming to make it three wins in a row in all competitions. After a shaky start, Keith Andrews’ side have recorded impressive back-to-back victories and will sense an opportunity against a Sunderland team hit by injuries. arts.ttl: Sunderland vs Brentford – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Sunderland welcome Brentford to the Stadium of Light on Saturday, with head coach Régis Le Bris desperate to halt a two-game losing streak. After a fantastic opening-day win, defeats in the league and cup have brought the newly-promoted side back down to earth, and this is a crucial home fixture to regain momentum. To do […] The post Sunderland vs Brentford – Predicted lineup and team news first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Sunderland vs Brentford – Match Preview and Team News
arts.sum: Sunderland return to the Stadium of Light on Saturday, aiming to halt a concerning slide, while visitors Brentford arrive full of confidence after turning their own season around. After a dream start to their top-flight return, Sunderland have suffered consecutive defeats in the league and the Carabao Cup. arts.ttl: Alexander-Arnold and Grealish left out of England squad
arts.sum: Elliot Anderson earns a first senior England nod after dazzling for Forest and Under-21s. Rashford and Wharton return; Foden also left out by Tuchel.
